Description: Deep conical cup with a flat base and straight sides expanding to the rim. Made of hand-worked red-brown Nile silt pottery, with clear marks of straw in the clay. Slightly elliptical in shape at the rim. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Like 5f in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic Pottery (1953) but smaller (cf. Proto 5k) Grave 107 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 109-110. The grave contained two bodies and a large quantity of pottery.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
